description1: When the record was last edited on your collections database
The code for the language in which your data is written, almost certainly English: `en`
The standard institution code used to describe the institution
The collection within your institution from which the specimen comes
The expedition name if this specimen was collected on an expedition
Pretty much always present for Museum specimen data.
Any field numbers - number given to the specimen when it was collected or at some interim time before it was registered into your Museum's collection.
description2: Do not use the field fieldNumber for the field number - it is reserved for numbers assigned to the collection location.

description1: The collector (or observer of a sighting)
For tissue samples this is always tissue

description3: Permit available, Permit not required, Permit not available, Unknown
